name: Seitrace
description: Integrates with Sei blockchain networks to provide token analytics, balance tracking, transaction history, and holder...

metadata.readme_excerpt: # Seitrace MCP The essential MCP (Model Context Protocol) server for the Sei blockchain. ## Available tools ðŸ§° **Five tools that form the resource-based interface (use in order 1â†’2â†’3â†’4):** - `list_resources` â€” list available resources (start here) - `list_resource_actions` â€” list actions for a resource - `get_resource_action_schema` â€” **REQUIRED** get the JSON Schema for an action before invoking - `invoke_resource_action` â€” invoke an action with payload matching the schema - `get_resource_action_snippet` â€” (optional) generate a code snippet to perform a resource action in the specified language **Supported resources** **General** - `general_faucet` - enable requesting faucet for developers - `general_rpc_lcd` - enable general rpc/lcd inquiries for the agents, and execute the rpc/lcd requests based on the demands - `general_associations` â€” query hybrid associations (EOA/assets/txs) across EVM and native Sei. Returns simplified pointer/pointee fields when applicable. **Insights** - `insights_address` â€” Query address data: details, transactions, token transfers. - `insights_erc20` â€” Query ERC-20 tokens: info, balances, transfers, holders. - `insights_cw20` â€” Query CW20 tokens: info, balances, transfers, holders. - `insights_native` â€” Query native tokens: info, transfers, balances, holders. - `insights_ics20` â€” Query ICS20 tokens: info, transfers, balances, holders. - `insights_erc721` â€” Qu
